I'll never forget my first date with Rachel - she was a free-spirited artist who wore a tattoo of a snake eating its own tail on her ankle. It's like the universe is conspiring against me to find someone who doesn't fit my ideal. Every woman I meet seems to be a caricature of some terrible cliche. I'm starting to think that online dating is just a waste of time, and that I'll never find someone who truly understands me.

As I scroll through my dating app feed now, I see all these profiles of women who seem perfect - smart, funny, and beautiful. But I know better. They're just pretending to be something they're not, just like all the others. I'm done wasting my time. Online dating is a lost cause, and I might as well just stick to my solo life.
